speaker: DUNCAN
text_entry: SCENE VII. Macbeth's castle.

speaker: DUNCAN
text_entry: Hautboys and torches. Enter a Sewer, and divers  Servants with dishes and service, and pass over the stage. Then enter MACBETH

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: If it were done when 'tis done, then 'twere well

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: It were done quickly: if the assassination

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Could trammel up the consequence, and catch

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: With his surcease success; that but this blow

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Might be the be-all and the end-all here,

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: But here, upon this bank and shoal of time,

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: We'ld jump the life to come. But in these cases

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: We still have judgment here; that we but teach

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Bloody instructions, which, being taught, return

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: To plague the inventor: this even-handed justice

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Commends the ingredients of our poison'd chalice

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: To our own lips. He's here in double trust;

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: First, as I am his kinsman and his subject,

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Strong both against the deed; then, as his host,

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Who should against his murderer shut the door,

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Not bear the knife myself. Besides, this Duncan

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Hath borne his faculties so meek, hath been

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: So clear in his great office, that his virtues

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Will plead like angels, trumpet-tongued, against

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: The deep damnation of his taking-off;

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: And pity, like a naked new-born babe,

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Striding the blast, or heaven's cherubim, horsed

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Upon the sightless couriers of the air,

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Shall blow the horrid deed in every eye,

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: That tears shall drown the wind. I have no spur

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: To prick the sides of my intent, but only

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Vaulting ambition, which o'erleaps itself

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: And falls on the other.

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Enter LADY MACBETH

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: How now! what news?

speaker: LADY MACBETH
text_entry: He has almost supp'd: why have you left the chamber?

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Hath he ask'd for me?

speaker: LADY MACBETH
text_entry: Know you not he has?

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: We will proceed no further in this business:

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: He hath honour'd me of late; and I have bought

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Golden opinions from all sorts of people,

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Which would be worn now in their newest gloss,

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Not cast aside so soon.

speaker: LADY MACBETH
text_entry: Was the hope drunk

speaker: LADY MACBETH
text_entry: Wherein you dress'd yourself? hath it slept since?

speaker: LADY MACBETH
text_entry: And wakes it now, to look so green and pale

speaker: LADY MACBETH
text_entry: At what it did so freely? From this time

speaker: LADY MACBETH
text_entry: Such I account thy love. Art thou afeard

speaker: LADY MACBETH
text_entry: To be the same in thine own act and valour

speaker: LADY MACBETH
text_entry: As thou art in desire? Wouldst thou have that

speaker: LADY MACBETH
text_entry: Which thou esteem'st the ornament of life,

speaker: LADY MACBETH
text_entry: And live a coward in thine own esteem,

speaker: LADY MACBETH
text_entry: Letting 'I dare not' wait upon 'I would,'

speaker: LADY MACBETH
text_entry: Like the poor cat i' the adage?

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Prithee, peace:

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: I dare do all that may become a man;

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Who dares do more is none.

speaker: LADY MACBETH
text_entry: What beast was't, then,

speaker: LADY MACBETH
text_entry: That made you break this enterprise to me?

speaker: LADY MACBETH
text_entry: When you durst do it, then you were a man;

speaker: LADY MACBETH
text_entry: And, to be more than what you were, you would

speaker: LADY MACBETH
text_entry: Be so much more the man. Nor time nor place

speaker: LADY MACBETH
text_entry: Did then adhere, and yet you would make both:

speaker: LADY MACBETH
text_entry: They have made themselves, and that their fitness now

speaker: LADY MACBETH
text_entry: Does unmake you. I have given suck, and know

speaker: LADY MACBETH
text_entry: How tender 'tis to love the babe that milks me:

speaker: LADY MACBETH
text_entry: I would, while it was smiling in my face,

speaker: LADY MACBETH
text_entry: Have pluck'd my nipple from his boneless gums,

speaker: LADY MACBETH
text_entry: And dash'd the brains out, had I so sworn as you

speaker: LADY MACBETH
text_entry: Have done to this.

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: If we should fail?

speaker: LADY MACBETH
text_entry: We fail!

speaker: LADY MACBETH
text_entry: But screw your courage to the sticking-place,

speaker: LADY MACBETH
text_entry: And we'll not fail. When Duncan is asleep--

speaker: LADY MACBETH
text_entry: Whereto the rather shall his day's hard journey

speaker: LADY MACBETH
text_entry: Soundly invite him--his two chamberlains

speaker: LADY MACBETH
text_entry: Will I with wine and wassail so convince

speaker: LADY MACBETH
text_entry: That memory, the warder of the brain,

speaker: LADY MACBETH
text_entry: Shall be a fume, and the receipt of reason

speaker: LADY MACBETH
text_entry: A limbeck only: when in swinish sleep

speaker: LADY MACBETH
text_entry: Their drenched natures lie as in a death,

speaker: LADY MACBETH
text_entry: What cannot you and I perform upon

speaker: LADY MACBETH
text_entry: The unguarded Duncan? what not put upon

speaker: LADY MACBETH
text_entry: His spongy officers, who shall bear the guilt

speaker: LADY MACBETH
text_entry: Of our great quell?

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Bring forth men-children only;

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: For thy undaunted mettle should compose

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Nothing but males. Will it not be received,

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: When we have mark'd with blood those sleepy two

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Of his own chamber and used their very daggers,

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: That they have done't?

speaker: LADY MACBETH
text_entry: Who dares receive it other,

speaker: LADY MACBETH
text_entry: As we shall make our griefs and clamour roar

speaker: LADY MACBETH
text_entry: Upon his death?

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: I am settled, and bend up

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Each corporal agent to this terrible feat.

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Away, and mock the time with fairest show:

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: False face must hide what the false heart doth know.

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Exeunt
